general.headline: Senior Legal Counsel at carsales.com.au
general.description:
I have over 12 years’ experience as a corporate and commercial lawyer, having worked as a corporate and M&A lawyer at Arnold Bloch Leibler and international law firm Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer in Moscow before moving in-house 9 years ago.

Since 2010 I have been Senior Legal Counsel at Pact Group Holdings Ltd, a highly acquisitive (40+ acquisitions in 14 years) ASX-listed packaging business which operates over 60 manufacturing sites throughout Australia, New Zealand and Asia. Pact Group has more than 4,000 employees across its operations and generates turnover in excess of A$1.2 billion.  Prior to working at Pact Group I spent three years as Corporate Solicitor at the Australian Grand Prix Corporation. 

I have broad experience advising on a range of legal issues, including: 

- general commercial contracts (including supply and procurement, sponsorship and confidentiality)
- mergers and acquisitions (as external counsel and internal counsel, including as project lead) 
- competition law 
- advising on liability and risk 
- commercial disputes (including contractual, employment and personal injury) 
- intellectual property 
- refinancing (including $1bn refinance of Pact Group by way of US ‘Term Loan B’) 
- project management (including expansion of Pact Group into Asia and various joint ventures)

jobs.description:
Role includes advising on broad range of commercial agreements (including supply and procurement) and significant merger and acquisition activity (both share and asset) and major projects (such as joint ventures and refinancing).

Also includes advising business on broad range of legal issues such as employment, workplace incidents, IP, advice on contractual positions and managing extensive panel of external legal advisors.  

Worked on December 2013 IPO of Pact Group on the Australian Stock Exchange (the largest IPO in the Australian market in 2013 and second largest packaging IPO ever completed globally).

In-house major events role with the organisers of the Formula 1 Australian Grand Prix and Australian MotoGP events. 

Role included negotiating a range of commercial agreements such as sponsorship (including naming rights) agreements, supply agreements and contractor engagements.  Also involved advising on intellectual property protection, legislation, advertising and promotions and government liaison.
Corporate department with a focus on private mergers and acquisitions

Corporate and Commercial practice group (including during Articles of Clerkship), with
      a particular focus on mergers and acquisitions

general.headline: Associate to the Hon Justice MM Gordon at High Court of Australia
general.description:
I am currently an Associate to the Hon Justice MM Gordon of the High Court of Australia. As an Australian qualified solicitor, I have previously worked in the London office of Quinn Emanuel Urquhart & Sullivan LLP, and the London and Tokyo offices of Herbert Smith Freehills LLP.  

I have a BCL (Masters in Law) from the University of Oxford, a Juris Doctor and Bachelor of Arts (International Relations and Australian Indigenous Studies) from the University of Melbourne.

My background is in commercial litigation and arbitration, often with an international angle. I have acted for hedge funds, investment and asset management firms, energy companies, distributors and property developers, amongst others, in cases stretching across Europe, Asia and the United States.

I am also passionate about human rights and access to justice, and I strive to do as much pro bono work as I can.  I am Chair of the Board for a grassroots non-profit organisation in Uganda called Leading Change Uganda, which works to improve living conditions, educational opportunities and skills training for women and children in small communities near Kampala.  I have volunteered legal services in the UK, including to the Royal Courts of Justice and Tower Hamlets Citizens Advice Bureaus, the International Senior Lawyers Project, Anti-Slavery International and Oxford Pro Bono Publico. In Australia, I have volunteered with the Asylum Seeker Resource Centre and the NSW Native Title Representative Body, amongst others.

https://leadingchangeuganda.wixsite.com/home

general.headline: Associate (Legal) at PwC Australia
general.description:
Otis is an Associate in the Corporate Group at PwC Legal.

Otis' key area of practice is private M&A, with experience across all stages of transactions including term sheets, due diligence, transaction document negotiation, FIRB and other regulatory approval, completion and post-completion implementation.

Otis also has experience in global reorganisations and has advised on complex regulatory compliance issues, corporate governance and company secretarial matters, commercial contracting and dispute resolution and court litigation.

Otis' experience includes a secondment to a top 15 ASX-listed company where he was responsible for drafting and negotiation of various commercial agreements and advising on general corporate and regulatory matters, providing him with a strong understanding of the client's commercial operations and needs.

general.headline: General Counsel & Company Secretary / Head of Corporate Development
general.description:
I am an experienced legal, corporate development and strategy professional with 20 years experience in legal, strategic and commercial roles. I have experience across a number of corporate functions including: 
- corporate and commercial law
- corporate development and M&A
- strategic planning
- business development and strategic partnerships
- commercial procurement and commodities management
- corporate governance and compliance

I believe in the power of good leadership and collaboration having formed and lead both large and small teams that have gained the respect of their colleagues and delivered outstanding results. And I relish in the opportunity to lead, or work within, teams and to create strategic partnerships to solve problems, simplify the complex and deliver great outcomes. 

I have over 10 years of experience reporting to CEOs, CFOs and Boards as both General Counsel/Company Secretary and as a commercial manager and have gained strong influencing and communication skills over this period. I am experienced in a wide range of corporate and commercial transactions, having worked on the successful completion of a number of acquisitions, divestments, joint ventures, capital raising, IPO, takeover and debt placements. I have also delivered successful outcomes across a range of commercial activities including procurement, commodities management, insurance, dispute resolution and intellectual property rights exploitation. I consider leadership, mental agility, adaptability, teamwork and resilience to be core attributes gained through this experience.

jobs.jobTitle: General Counsel & Company Secretary / Head of Corporate Development
jobs.description:
Reporting to the CEO, I have responsibility for legal affairs, company secretarial /
      
      governance, M&A and corporate development for the PACT Group.

Reported to the CEO and Chairman. Responsible for strategic planning processes, mergers and acquisitions, provision of project management and strategic guidance for major strategic projects and business development projects. 

I worked alongside commercial managers to identify and codify core capabilities and processes and develop business cases for major operational and capital projects, including proposed acquisitions. 

I also liaised closely with the CEO and Board in creating revised strategic options for the company, evaluating those options and setting out a pathway for execution.  This ultimately led to a takeover offer for the company in which I facilitated the company's effective response through the provision of tactical guidance, developing a process for interaction with the bidders and negotiating scheme of arrangement terms (with the Chairman / CEO).

Reported to the CEO and managed a legal and governance team with responsibility for
      all legal, compliance, risk management and corporate secretarial matters for the
      Group. This required the establishment of a new Board and governance structure and
      
      company secretarial function. Also delivered innovative new legal solutions

... See more

Reporting to the CEO, the role included the assessment and execution of mergers and
      acquisitions and other corporate transactions including leading the company's capital
      raising, negotiating, structuring and executing a number of acquisitions and
      
      subsequently executing the new CEO's divestment programme, resulting in

... See more

Reporting to the Group General Counsel and dotted line to the Chief Operating Officer with a team responsible for all operational legal and contractual matters for all of Burns Philp's global operations, including Goodman Fielder, Uncle Toby's, Bluebird Foods and AB Mauri. Worked on a number of major corporate transactions including the sale of AB Mauri and the IPO of Goodman Fielder. Also successfully renegotiated a number of major commercial arrangements including ingredients supply and packaging purchasing.

A small venture capital firm specialising in raising equity finance for, and providing
      advisory services to, early stage new media businesses. Investments included
      
      kitbag.com and Skive Interactive.

general.headline: Recruiting for Compliance and Risk Management Recruitment - Permanent & Contract Placements
general.description:
Barry Maurer is a Director with Compliance and Risk Management Recruitment.

The CRM Recruitment team includes myself, Greg Goodman (Director), David Bakes (Associate Director), Vicki Williams (Associate Consultant), Allison Tassone (Researcher), Tonya Goode (Researcher) and Angie Ilagan (Office Manager).

As a specialist agency, CRM has spent a lot of time helping both clients and candidates to
understand the market dynamics and in providing advice on career opportunities.

We have relied less on responses to advertisements, relative to our ability to source through our
database and our strong internal and referral network.

We work very well together and our combined experience in the risk, compliance and audit sector enables us to thoroughly understand our clients and our candidates.

Please contact me on 0413 941 533 or David Bakes on 0412 719 686 for any queries and applications regarding positions on our website www.crmrecruitment.com.au

jobs.description:
A specialist legal recruitment agency offering personalised advice and unique opportunities within Australia and internationally brought to you from some of Australia's leading legal recruiters. 

Kensington Parry work with a range of boutique, mid- tier and international law firms as well as companies looking to grow their in house legal function. 

Kensington Parry focuses on contingent and retained legal recruitment and can provide advice on legal market trends as well as salary advice.

If you would like to discuss your resourcing requirements or alternatively, would like to understand your options in the current legal market, please feel free to contact me at +61 452 200 375 , email me at rbuchman@kensingtonparry.com or visit our website www.kensingtonparry.com

general.headline: Principal Consultant at KBE Legal Hub
general.description:
I specialise in advising lawyers with 1 year PAE through to Senior Associate/Special Counsel level. I provide our national, international and boutique law firm client base with access to the best lawyers in the market.

I commenced my consulting career with a national recruitment firm. I spent 10 years advising clients across various industries where she built and managed a number of high performing teams. Prior to joining KBE Legal Hub, I managed a multi-million dollar client portfolio for a global relocation company, overseeing daily operations and providing strategic support.

I have developed a reputation for delivering highly customised solutions, to both lawyers and law firms. I always go out of my way to deliver an exceptional level of service.

I am currently completing a Bachelor of Commerce, majoring in Business Law and Management.

jobs.description:
KBE Legal Hub is the home of Western Australia’s best legal talent.

Our team consists of Managing Partners, In-House Legal Counsel, Senior Lawyers, Legal Recruitment Consultants and Law Firm Futurists. 

We provide permanent and flexible working options for Western Australia’s lawyers, law firms and in-house teams. We empower lawyers to choose how and when you work, with market leading law firms and ASX listed/private in-house teams. We provide our clients with unrivalled legal talent, as and when you need it.

KBE Legal Hub has united with one clear purpose – to make the Western Australian legal profession a happier, healthier place for lawyers, law firms and in-house teams.

We are committed to helping lawyers achieve work/life integration and complete super interesting work – whatever that means to you!

Team Leader - Candidate Services (December 2015 - July 2016)
Account Manager (August 2014 - December 2015)
Consultant (September 2006 - July 2014)
Team Leader (April 2013 - December 2013)

As one of the region’s largest employers, Chandler Macleod have over sixty years of experience finding the right person-job-environment fit using their unique BestFit™ methodology.

Supporting a diverse array of clients and candidates within various industries and sectors, I managed assignments across both the temporary and permanent recruitment divisions as well as managing high performing teams.

general.headline: Associate, Banking and Finance, Clifford Chance LLP
general.description:
Clifford Chance has a world leading Banking and Finance team and is involved in many of the syndicate loan market's ground-breaking deals. The team takes a multi disciplinary approach and has an unrivalled breadth and depth of experience working with banks, finance houses, funds, institutions and corporates globally.

I advise on complex debt financing arrangements for lenders, sponsors, arrangers and large corporates. My role allows me to work on a range of financing matters, from acquisition to project financings to alternate debt raising activities. 
I advise clients in relation to best protecting their security interests, restructuring and insolvency, trade finance and commodities trading.
I advise on fintech, payment platforms digital currencies and tokenisations and reducing points of friction in banking. 
I am enjoying the journey toward digitisation of currencies and open banking.
I am admitted in the Supreme Courts of Queensland and Western Australia and the High Court of Australia.

jobs.description:
A member of the Australian Banking and Finance team, working on complex financing
      and restructuring arrangements and advising clients on various issues.
      

    In this role I've also delivered a number of presentations to clients and industries,
      contributed to various global guides and client updates and delivered thought
      
      leadership on key issues within banking and finance.

In this role I advised on corporate, construction, real estate and acquisition financing arrangements. Conducted due diligence in relation to mining projects, and financing and security arrangements. Delivered various advice in relation to general corporate and securities and regularly advised in relation to personal property and real property issues.

In this role I mainly advised on real estate, corporate and restructuring financing transactions. Working with clients on large corporate acquisitions and leveraged deals, each on a pan-European and transatlantic basis and also on a local jurisdiction level for Ogier, the world's number 1 offshore law firm. Clients were lenders, security agents, sponsors, trusts, funds and large corporate groups.
A member of the government blockchain and virtual currency proposition focus group. Developed an understanding of various spv's used in the offshore market.

In this role I worked within the Banking and Finance team and assisted on real estate and acquisition finance matters. I enjoyed assisting Phil McMahon on various transactions and developed a collaborative approach to problem solving.
Previously seated in Corporate M&A & EPI practice groups. During this role I was an active member of the community committee.

Enjoyed managing projects, trouble shooting the delivery of care services in remote
      areas, ensuring mine sites met their health permit requirements, working with
      
      emergency response teams.
Here I enjoyed leading teams and advising at both tactical and strategic levels.

Manager of an inpatient acute medical ward, then inpatient medical oncology unit.
      Transitioned to nursing services manager of Craigieburn health service. Enjoyed the
      leadership role and developed my skills in financial management and project
      
      management.

general.headline: Strategy, Execution & Change | Corporate Development | Leading for Impact | Transdisciplinarity | GAICD
general.description:
A well-rounded, inspiring, solutions focussed, international business leader and advisor with a specialism in finance and excellent credentials in strategy, operations, client service and governance to drive strategic change / corporate development in complex environments.  

Blended experience in Big 4 accounting firms and well recognised global brands in multiple industries (financial services, IT services, food and beverage, manufacturing) in developed and emerging markets.  Strategic experience includes advice on strategic distribution deals, finance shared services redesign projects, cross-border M&A advice and implementation. 

Unique value proposition: 
-  Trusted business partnership to the executive leadership enabling key decision making and quality outcomes
 - An innovative larger perspective for harvesting actionable strategic insights and foresights for complex multi-disciplinary problem solving and organisation effectiveness
- An in-depth assessment of underlying key stakeholder needs and co-creating solutions 
- Identification of a few key strategic priorities 
- Creating vital alignment and focus across teams in cross-cultural and multi-disciplinary settings

Graduate of the Australian Institute of Company Directors, Chartered Accountant, Masters of Tax 

Specialities: Structured problem solving, business acumen; inquiry and strategic thinking; finance and accounting;  authentic leadership, advanced influencing, negotiation, complex stakeholder management; project and change management; strategy shaping and delivery with change building trust; interdisciplinary collaboration and conflict management; advisor and regulator management; agile learning mindset; coaching and mentoring

Projects included: Integration of regional businesses following global M&A, finance and tax function transformation, entry and exit in key Asian and Latin American markets, strategic distribution deal advisory in Oceania & Brazil, regulatory crisis management in a key market.  Recipient/nominee of various CEO/Chairman awards for four years.  Speaker at Transfer Pricing Conference - 2014, 2015

jobs.description:
Consultant specialising in M&A and international transactions tax advisory (including legal advisory) work in digital / e-commerce, consumer / retail, manufacturing and aviation industries. Work with lawyers and investment banks on transactional projects, including inbound / outbound business acquisitions, corporate structuring / financing, demergers, due diligence processes, capital transactions, asset acquisitions, financial valuations / modelling (including Taxation of Financial Arrangements) and infrastructure bids. 
Work on business development initiatives including industry / law reform, industry presentations and pitches / tenders for new work, contributing to the practice and firm's broader business strategy. 
Design and rollout of the technical training program for consultants in the Corporate Tax team.

Digital marketing and project management. Consultant to FMCG and government clients on marketing strategy, analytics, communications and community (CSR) programs. 
Brand and consumer analysis. Developed comprehensive digital reporting packs to establish and monitor a broader range of metrics on which to measure products. Worked on brand activations and designing campaign for high-visibility events including the London 2012 Olympic Games. Worked with clients and legal counsel on publication of content labeling, competition T&Cs, marketing-to-children policies and creative commons matters.
Participated in pitches and tenders for new project work, contributed to the agency’s business development plans.
Also active in pro bono work with charity Western Chances.

Membership co-chair of IABC (International Association of Business Communicators)

general.description: Experienced Human Resources Executive with a demonstrated history of working in manufacturing and travel & tourism. Skilled in Strategic HR Planning, Employee Experience, M&A change management, and negotiation, underpinned by a Bachelor of Law and Master of Business Administration (MBA) with specialization in Human Resources Management.

jobs.description:
Partnering with the executive team, taking a strategic approach to human resources
      
      development to support long-term business goals and outcomes.

Development and implementation of best practice HR policies and procedure framework across multiple business unites (tourism and manufacturing) across Australia, New Zealand and the US, Recruitment and Selection, Performance management and disciplinary process, Manager advice on employee and industrial relations as well as  ensuring compliance with regulatory framework across all business units and countries of operation, Executive management advice and HR presentation and reporting in monthly executive management meetings

Negotiation of preferred agreements with travel agents (all tourism sales channels from inbound and wholesale to retail and web based), Networking and relationship building,  Achievement of assigned strategic account objectives, Representation of Apollo range of products & services to assigned accounts at major Trade and Consumer Shows

Responsibility for maintaining long-term relationships with European business partners,
      Development of new business channels and successful on-boarding of new partner
      agents, Product presentations and training Representation of product range at major
      
      Trade and Consumer Shows

Promotion and sales of nightly educational programs and presentations about the Great Barrier Reef, Maintenance of existing business relationships with local dive businesses and tourism operators/travel agencies, Identification of new business opportunities, Development and execution of advertisement strategies, including media press releases etc.
